## 大同区(大同區)
---
## Datong District, Taipei
### Dàtóng Qū
---
- **definition:** Datong District, Taipei
- **pinyin:** Dàtóng Qū
- **components:**
  - 大同
    - dàtóng
    - Great Unity; Datong
  - 区(區)
    - qū
    - district; area; region; zone
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 大同(大同) (dàtóng, "Great Unity") is a Confucian utopian ideal from the Book of Rites (禮記/礼记), and 區(區) (qū, "district") refers to an administrative division.
  - **interpretation:** The term 大同區 (大同區) (dàtóng qū, "Datong District") is named after a philosophical concept emphasizing harmony and unity. It symbolizes the aspiration for a harmonious community within the administrative area.
- **examples:**
  - 我住在大同区(大同區)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài Dàtóng Qū.
    - I live in Datong District.
  - 大同区(大同區)历史悠久(歷史悠久)，街道繁华(街道繁華)。
    - Dàtóng Qū lìshǐ yōujiǔ, jiēdào fánhuá.
    - Datong District has a long history, and its streets are bustling.
  - 大同区(大同區)保留传统(保留傳統)，吸引游客(吸引遊客)。
    - Dàtóng Qū bǎoliú chuántǒng, xīyǐn yóukè.
    - Datong District preserves traditions and attracts tourists.
### 大同区(大同區) → 大同(大同)
- **definition:** Great Unity; Datong
- **pinyin:** dàtóng
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - great; big; large
  - 同
    - tóng
    - same; unity; together; common
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:**
    - 大(大) (dà, "great") + 同(同) (tóng, "same; unity") =
    - Great Unity, a concept of harmony where all people are united as one.
  - **interpretation:** 大同(大同) (dàtóng, "Great Unity") is a Confucian utopian ideal described in the Book of Rites (禮記/礼记) where society achieves a state of perfect harmony, justice, and equality. It is often referenced in both historical and philosophical contexts as an aspiration for social order.
- **examples:**
  - 全世界人民向往大同(大同)。
    - Quán shìjiè rénmín xiàngwǎng dàtóng.
    - People around the world yearn for Great Unity.
  - 先賢夢想大同(大同)，後人追求和諧(後人追求和諧)。
    - Xiānxián mèngxiǎng dàtóng, hòurén zhuīqiú héxié.
    - The wise of the past dream of Great Unity, while later generations strive for harmony.
  - 柏拉图論大同(大同)，啟發現代理想社會(啟發現代理想社會)。
    - Bǎilātú lùn dàtóng, qǐfā xiàndài lǐxiǎng shèhuì.
    - Plato discussed Great Unity, inspiring the modern ideal society.
### 大同区(大同區) → 大同(大同) → 大(大)
- **definition:** great; big; large
- **pinyin:** dà
- **components:**
  - 夫
    - fū
    - man
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a person facing forward ->
    - Borrowed phonetically for 'big'; original form of 夫(夫) (fū, 'man')
  - **interpretation:** The character 大(dà) depicts a person facing forward, representing 'big' by suggesting the idea of someone standing prominently. Although often thought of as a person with outstretched arms, early scripts do not support this interpretation. It was originally the form of 夫(夫) (fū, 'man') and was later phonetically borrowed for the meaning 'big.'
- **examples:**
  - 这个房子很大(這個房子很大)。
    - Zhè ge fángzi hěn dà.
    - This house is very big.
  - 大海波涛汹涌(大海波濤洶湧)，展现出大自然的力量(展現出大自然的力量)。
    - Dàhǎi bōtāo xiōngyǒng, zhǎnxiàn chū dàzìrán de lìliàng.
    - The vast ocean waves surge, showcasing the power of nature.
  - 大人物登场(大人物登場)，留下传奇(留下傳奇)。
    - Dà rénwù dēngchǎng, liúxià chuánqí.
    - Great figures make an appearance, leaving behind legends.
### 大同区(大同區) → 大同(大同) → 大(大) → 夫(夫)
- **definition:** man
- **pinyin:** fū
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - big
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a variant form of 大(大) (dà, "big") representing an adult man with a hairpin ->
    - became associated with 夫(夫) (fū, "man").
  - **interpretation:** 夫(夫) (fū, "man") was visually similar to 大(大) (dà, "big") and was originally interchangeable. The addition of the horizontal stroke was interpreted as a hairpin, symbolizing adulthood for men.
- **examples:**
  - 此夫心怀大志(此夫心懷大志)。
    - Cǐ fū xīn huái dà zhì.
    - This man has lofty aspirations.
  - 他勤劳努力(他勤勞努力)，堪称良夫(堪稱良夫)。
    - Tā qín láo nǔ lì, kān chēng liáng fū.
    - He works diligently and is regarded as an exemplary man.
### 大同区(大同區) → 大同(大同) → 同(同)
- **definition:** same; unity; together; common
- **pinyin:** tóng
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - "mouth"
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Originally depicted as a pipe 筒(筒) (tǒng, "pipe") ->
    - 口 added as decoration ->
    - interpreted as mouth 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") giving orders ->
    - evolved to mean togetherness and unity
  - **interpretation:** The character 同(同) (tóng, "same; unity; together; common") originally depicted a pipe but later took on the symbolic meaning of unity, possibly influenced by the shared cooperation in activities like music or rigid group tasks. The addition of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") emphasizes communication and collaboration.
- **examples:**
  - 我们同心协力(我們同心協力)。
    - Wǒmen tóngxīn xiélì.
    - We work together with one heart and mind.
  - 他们穿着同款衣服(他們穿著同款衣服)，看起来十分整齐(看起來十分整齊)。
    - Tāmen chuānzhe tóng kuǎn yīfú, kàn qǐlái shífēn zhěngqí.
    - They are wearing the same style of clothes and look very orderly.
### 大同区(大同區) → 大同(大同) → 同(同) → 口(口)
- **definition:** "mouth"
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** The character 口(kǒu, 'mouth') is a straightforward pictogram that visually represents an open mouth. It is a fundamental character in the Chinese language, often used both as an independent word and as a component in more complex characters, lending a semantic association to ideas relating to speech, openings, or enclosures.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，大声喊叫(大聲喊叫)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, dàshēng hǎnjiào.
    - He opened his mouth and shouted loudly.
  - 这口饭入口即化(這口飯入口即化)。
    - Zhè kǒu fàn rùkǒu jíhuà.
    - This mouthful of food melts in your mouth.
  - 小女孩咬了一口苹果(小女孩咬了一口蘋果)，露出甜美的笑容(露出甜美的笑容)。
    - Xiǎo nǚhái yǎole yī kǒu píngguǒ, lùchū tiánměi de xiàoróng.
    - The little girl took a bite of the apple and smiled sweetly.
### 大同区(大同區) → 区(區)
- **definition:** district; area; region; zone
- **pinyin:** qū
- **components:**
  - 匸
    - xì
    - enclosure
  - 品
    - pǐn
    - goods/people
  - 乂
    - yì
    - to manage
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:**
    - 匸 (enclosed space) + 品 (many people) =
    - many people within an enclosure ->
    - area, district
  - **interpretation:** The character 區(區) (qū, 'district') visually represents an area where many people reside, symbolized by 品(品) (pǐn, 'goods/people') enclosed within 匸(匸) (xì, 'enclosure'). This layout effectively conveys the idea of a defined space containing a community or district.
  - **simplification:** 區(區) was simplified to 区(區) by reducing 品(品) to 乂(乂) (yì, 'to manage'), keeping the enclosure meaning while reducing strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 我住在繁华的区(我住在繁華的區)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài fán huá de qū.
    - I live in a bustling district.
  - 古代文人常在这区(古代文人常在這區)，寻觅灵感(尋覓靈感)。
    - Gǔ dài wén rén cháng zài zhè qū, xún mì líng gǎn.
    - Ancient literati often sought inspiration in this region.
  - 他参观了多个区(他參觀了多個區)，体验了不同的文化(體驗了不同的文化)。
    - Tā cān guān le duō gè qū, tǐ yàn le bù tóng de wén huà.
    - He visited several districts and experienced diverse cultures.
### 大同区(大同區) → 区(區) → 匸(匸)
- **definition:** enclosure
- **pinyin:** xì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - 𠃊 (symbolic graphic) ->
    - depicts an enclosure hiding something or someone ->
    - evolved to represent a concealed space or item
  - **interpretation:** The character 匸(xì, 'box') is a pictogram representing a concealed or enclosed space. Its graphical form suggests something contained or hidden, which aligns with its meaning as a 'box' or an enclosure. Unlike other related pictograms that depict physical containers, 匸 emphasizes the aspect of concealment or secrecy.
- **examples:**
  - 他把匸搬到了房间角落(他把匸搬到了房間角落)。
    - Tā bǎ xì bān dào le fángjiān jiǎoluò.
    - He moved the box to the corner of the room.
  - 我们在仓库找到了匸(我們在倉庫找到了匸)，里面装有秘密文件(裡面裝有秘密文件)。
    - Wǒmen zài cāngkù zhǎodào le xì, lǐmiàn zhuāng yǒu mìmì wénjiàn.
    - We found the box in the warehouse, and it contained secret documents.
  - 工厂工人把旧匸清理了(工廠工人把舊匸清理了)，然后再利用(然後再利用)。
    - Gōngchǎng gōngrén bǎ jiù xì qīnglǐ le, ránhòu zài lìyòng.
    - Factory workers cleaned the old box and then reused it.
### 大同区(大同區) → 区(區) → 品(品)
- **definition:** goods/people
- **pinyin:** pǐn
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:**
    - Three 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') arranged together =
    - multiple mouths speaking or consuming ->
    - representing many or various items
  - **interpretation:** The use of three mouths suggests plurality or variety. It's similar in structure to 晶(晶) (jīng, 'sparkle'), which uses three 日(日) (rì, 'sun') to suggest brightness or vibrancy with multiple light sources.
- **examples:**
  - 比赛吸引了数以千计的品(比賽吸引了數以千計的品)，个个英姿飒爽(個個英姿颯爽)。
    - Bǐsài xīyǐnle shù yǐ qiān jì de pǐn, gège yīngzī sàshuǎng.
    - The competition attracted thousands of people, and everyone looked heroic.
  - 节日庆典上品众多(節日慶典上品眾多)，场面热烈非凡(場面熱烈非凡)。
    - Jiérì qìngdiǎn shàng pǐn zhòngduō, chǎngmiàn rèliè fēifán.
    - The festive celebration saw a large crowd, and the scene was extraordinarily lively.
  - 广场上聚集了众多品(廣場上聚集了眾多品)，大家热情互动(大家熱情互動)。
    - Guǎngchǎng shàng jùjíle zhòngduō pǐn, dàjiā rèqíng hùdòng.
    - The square gathered a multitude of people, and everyone interacted enthusiastically.

### 大同区(大同區) → 区(區) → 乂(乂)
- **definition:** to manage
- **pinyin:** yì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a tool similar to a knife or sickle ->
    - used to mow or cut weed
  - **interpretation:** The character 乂(yì, 'to manage') originally depicted a tool like a knife or scissors, symbolizing the action of cutting or managing vegetation. Its historical imagery reflects functions related to mowing or cutting, which metaphorically extended to managing tasks.

## 三弦(三弦)
---
## three-stringed Chinese lute used in Pingtan
### sānxián
---
- **definition:** three-stringed Chinese lute used in Pingtan
- **pinyin:** sānxián
- **components:**
  - 三
    - sān
    - three
  - 弦
    - xián
    - string
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 三(三) (sān, "three") + 弦(弦) (xián, "string")
  - **interpretation:** The word 三弦(三弦) (sānxián, "three-stringed lute") refers to a traditional Chinese musical instrument with three strings. It is often used in the storytelling art form known as Pingtan, popular in the Jiangsu and Zhejiang provinces.
- **examples:**
  - 他听三弦的旋律陶醉(他聽三弦的旋律陶醉)。
    - Tā tīng sānxián de xuànlǜ táozuì.
    - He becomes enchanted by the melody of the three-stringed lute.
  - 在评弹表演中(在評彈表演中)，艺人弹奏三弦伴奏(藝人彈奏三弦伴奏)。
    - Zài píngtán biǎoyǎn zhōng, yìrén dànzòu sānxián bànzòu.
    - During the Pingtan performance, the artist plays the three-stringed lute to accompany the show.
  - 古时的文人常以三弦为乐器(古時的文人常以三弦為樂器)。
    - Gǔshí de wénrén cháng yǐ sānxián wéi yuèqì.
    - In ancient times, scholars often used the three-stringed lute as a musical instrument.
### 三弦(三弦) → 三(三)
- **definition:** three
- **pinyin:** sān
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogram
  - **description:**
    - 一(一) (yī, "one") triplicated ->
    - 三(三) (sān, "three")
  - **interpretation:** The character 三(三) (sān, "three") is an ideogram depicting the concept of the number three through the use of three parallel horizontal strokes. This straightforward representation makes it consistent with related numeric characters like 一(一) (yī, "one") and 二(二) (èr, "two").
- **examples:**
  - 今天我买了三斤苹果(今天我買了三斤蘋果)。
    - Jīntiān wǒ mǎi le sān jīn píngguǒ.
    - Today I bought three jin of apples.
  - 他有三支笔(他有三支筆)，我只想要其中一支(我只想要其中一支)。
    - Tā yǒu sān zhī bǐ, wǒ zhǐ xiǎng yào qízhōng yī zhī.
    - He has three pens, but I only want one of them.
  - 他们吃了三碗面(他們吃了三碗麵)，觉得非常满意(覺得非常滿意)。
    - Tāmen chī le sān wǎn miàn, juéde fēicháng mǎnyì.
    - They ate three bowls of noodles and felt very satisfied.
### 三弦(三弦) → 弦(弦)
- **definition:** string
- **pinyin:** xián
- **components:**
  - 糸
    - mì
    - silk thread
  - 玄
    - xuán
    - dark/mysterious
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 糸(糸) (mì, "silk thread") + 玄(玄) (xuán) =
    - thread or string-themed meaning ->
    - string of a bow or musical instrument
  - **interpretation:** The character 弦(xián, "string") combines 糸(糸) (mì, "silk thread") as the semantic part to indicate its association with threads or strings, and 玄(玄) (xuán) provides the phonetic element. Together, it conveys the idea of threads used as strings in bows or musical instruments.
- **examples:**
  - 吉他有六根弦(吉他有六根弦)。
    - Jítā yǒu liù gēn xián.
    - The guitar has six strings.
  - 我拨动古琴的弦(我撥動古琴的弦)，奏出优美的旋律(奏出優美的旋律)。
    - Wǒ bōdòng gǔqín de xián, zòuchū yōuměi de xuànlǜ.
    - I pluck the strings of the guqin and play a beautiful melody.

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a skein of silk
  - **interpretation:** 糸(糸) (sī, 'silk') visually represents intertwined threads or fibers, emphasizing the appearance of silk strands.

    - gǔdài de yīwù duō shǐyòng sī zhīzào, zhǎnxiàn gōngjiàng de jìyì.

### 三弦(三弦) → 弦(弦) → 玄(玄)

- **components:**

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:**

  - 这幅山水画(這幅山水畫)充满玄妙意境(充滿玄妙意境)。

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a thin silk thread

    - top of traditional cloth in 衣(衣) (yī, "clothing") ->
    - mark over silk threads in 玄(玄) (xuán, "mysterious") ->
    - top of knife/chisel to mark prisoners in 辛(辛) (xīn, "bitter") ->
    - grass in 离(离) (lí, "leave")
  - **interpretation:** 亠 is primarily a pictogram that initially represented a cover with a handle. However, its usage varies in different characters, symbolizing roofs, heads, tops of clothing, and marks, showing its flexibility and evolution in form and meaning across contexts.

  - 古代书法作品中(古代書法作品中)，亠显示出独特的审美价值(亠顯示出獨特的審美價值)。
    - Gǔdài shūfǎ zuòpǐn zhōng, tóu xiǎnshì chū dútè de shěnměi jiàzhí.
    - In ancient calligraphy, 亠 demonstrates a unique aesthetic value.

- **definition:** picturesque scenery

  - **type:** compound word

Together, they create the phrase 江山如畫(江山如画) (jiāngshān rúhuà, "picturesque scenery"), evoking an image of nature so beautifully composed it resembles a work of art.

    - He walks carefully because if his foot gets injured, it becomes difficult to move forward.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 辵(辵) → 止(止) → 趾(趾)
- **definition:** foot
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **components:**
  - 足
    - zú
    - foot
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - stop
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 足(足) (zú, "foot") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") =
    - semantic: foot + phonetic: stop ->
    - toe
  - **interpretation:** The character combines 足(足) (zú, "foot") as the semantic indicator and 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") as the phonetic component to represent the idea of a 'toe,' which is a part of the foot.
- **examples:**
  - 他的趾因寒冷而僵硬了(他的趾因寒冷而僵硬了)。
    - tā de zhǐ yīn hánlěng ér jiāngyìng le.
    - His toe became stiff due to the cold.
  - 我走路时(我走路時)，不小心扭到了趾(不小心扭到了趾)。
    - wǒ zǒulù shí, bù xiǎoxīn niǔ dào le zhǐ.
    - While I was walking, I accidentally twisted my toe.
  - 古代剑客战斗时(古代劍客戰鬥時)，常因疏忽伤及趾(常因疏忽傷及趾)。
    - gǔdài jiànkè zhàndòu shí, cháng yīn shūhū shāng jí zhǐ.
    - Ancient swordsmen often injured their toes due to carelessness during battles.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 辵(辵) → 止(止) → 趾(趾) → 足(足)
- **definition:** foot
- **pinyin:** zú
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a leg ->
    - originally depicted as ⽦ ->
    - represents 'foot'
  - **interpretation:** The character 足(zú, 'foot') is a pictographic representation of a human leg, which directly portrays the concept of a 'foot'. The pictographic origin emphasizes its fundamental meaning in the language.
- **examples:**
  - 他受伤后(他受傷後)，他的足不能动(他的足不能動)。
    - tā shòushāng hòu, tā de zú bù néng dòng。
    - After he was injured, his foot couldn't move.
  - 小明打球时(小明打球時)，不小心扭伤了足(不小心扭傷了足)。
    - xiǎo míng dǎ qiú shí, bù xiǎoxīn niǔ shāng le zú。
    - When Xiaoming was playing ball, he accidentally twisted his foot.
  - 我每天锻炼足部(我每天鍛鍊足部)。
    - wǒ měitiān duànliàn zúbù。
    - I exercise my foot muscles every day.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 辵(辵) → 止(止) → 龰(龰)
- **definition:** stylized feet
- **pinyin:** yù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a footprint pointing up, originally meaning "foot" ->
    - stylized as 龰 (footprint)
  - **interpretation:** 龰(yù) is a stylized depiction of a footprint with toes pointing upwards, representing the concept of a foot. It evolved from an oracle script character that depicted a foot with three toes and a sole.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 辵(辵) → 止(止) → 手(手)
- **definition:** hand
- **pinyin:** shǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a hand with fingers; top stroke is a bent over middle finger, horizontal strokes represent fingers
  - **interpretation:** The character 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") is a direct pictorial representation of a human hand with all five fingers, which distinguishes it from similar characters representing claws or simplified fingers. This visually conveys its meaning as a hand clearly.
- **examples:**
  - 他用手写字(他用手寫字)。
    - Tā yòng shǒu xiě zì.
    - He writes with his hand.
  - 妈妈牵着我的手走路(媽媽牽著我的手走路)。
    - Māmā qiān zhe wǒ de shǒu zǒu lù.
    - Mom holds my hand while walking.
  - 他的手很温暖(他的手很溫暖)，带给我力量(帶給我力量)。
    - Tā de shǒu hěn wēn nuǎn, dài gěi wǒ lìliàng.
    - His hand is very warm, giving me strength.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 云(雲)
- **definition:** cloud
- **pinyin:** yún
- **components:**
  - 二
    - èr
    - two
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 云(云) (yún, "say") + phonetic: 二(二) (èr) =
    - cloud association; originally depicted the form of clouds
  - **interpretation:** The character 云(云) (yún, "cloud") combines 云(云) (yún, 'say') as a semantic element, originally meaning 'to say' or 'to speak,' but is used phonetically to represent a similar-sounding word for 'cloud.' The character was simplified from 雲(雲) to 云(云), retaining its phonetic and semantic components.
  - **simplification:** The traditional 雲(雲) was simplified by removing the radical 厶(厶) (sī, "private") and merging 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") with 二(二) (èr, "two") for a simpler form 云(云).
- **examples:**
  - 天空中飘着洁白的云(天空中飄著潔白的雲)。
    - Tiānkōng zhōng piāo zhe jiébái de yún.
    - Beautiful white clouds are floating in the sky.
  - 乌云密布时(烏雲密佈時)，可能马上下雨(可能馬上下雨)。
    - Wūyún mìbù shí, kěnéng mǎshàng xiàyǔ.
    - When dark clouds gather, it might rain soon.
### 运动(運動) → 运(運) → 云(雲) → 二(二)
- **definition:** two
- **pinyin:** èr
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts two parallel strokes ->
    - represents the number two
  - **interpretation:** The character 二(二) (èr, "two") consists of two horizontal lines that visually represent the concept of 'two'. This method of using parallel strokes to denote numbers is a straightforward representation of quantity, similar to how 一(一) (yī, "one") represents 'one' and 三(三) (sān, "three") represents 'three'.
- **examples:**
  - 我有二支笔(我有二支筆)。
    - Wǒ yǒu èr zhī bǐ.
    - I have two pens.
  - 他买了二个苹果(他買了二個蘋果)，我们一起分享(我們一起分享)。
    - Tā mǎi le èr gè píngguǒ, wǒmen yīqǐ fēnxiǎng.
    - He bought two apples, and we shared them together.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動)
- **definition:** move; act; stir; change
- **pinyin:** dòng
- **components:**
  - 力
    - lì
    - strength
  - 重
    - zhòng
    - heavy
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 力(力) (lì, "strength") + 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy") =
    - effort applied to shift weight ->
    - move
  - **interpretation:** 力(力) (lì, "strength") indicates action or exertion of force, while 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy") serves as a phonetic component capturing the character's pronunciation. Together, they convey the idea of using strength to move or change something.
  - **simplification:** 动(動): Removed 艹(艹) from 重(重), leaving just another simpler form to represent the sound and meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 他动了动手指(他動了動手指)，同意了建议(同意了建議)。
    - Tā dòngle dòng shǒuzhǐ, tóngyìle jiànyì.
    - He moved his finger and agreed to the suggestion.
  - 心动不已(心動不已)。
    - Xīn dòng bù yǐ.
    - His heart is constantly stirred.
  - 局势频繁动荡(局勢頻繁動蕩)，民众渴望安定(民眾渴望安定)。
    - Jú shì pínfán dòng dàng, mínzhòng kěwàng āndìng.
    - The situation is frequently changing, and the people long for stability.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 力(力)
- **definition:** strength
- **pinyin:** lì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts either an arm bending out from the side of the body, or a wooden plough
  - **interpretation:** The character 力(lì, 'strength') visually represents physical power through the image of an arm or tool, emphasizing the fundamental concept of muscular force.
- **examples:**
  - 他用尽全力(他用盡全力)，赢得比赛(贏得比賽)。
    - Tā yòng jìn quánlì, yíng dé bǐsài.
    - He used all his strength to win the competition.
  - 他把力气用在学习上(他把力氣用在學習上)。
    - Tā bǎ lìqì yòng zài xuéxí shàng.
    - He applies his strength to his studies.
  - 面对困难(面對困難)，他毫不退缩(他毫不退縮)，全力以赴(全力以赴)。
    - Miànduì kùnnán, tā háo bù tuìsuō, quánlì yǐ fù.
    - Facing difficulties, he neither retreats nor gives up, but goes all out.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重)
- **definition:** heavy
- **pinyin:** zhòng
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - man
  - 東
    - dōng
    - bag
  - 土
    - tǔ
    - earth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound ( 形聲 / 形声 , OC *doŋ, *doŋʔ, *doŋs ) and ideogrammic compound ( 會意 / 会意 )
  - **description:**
    - 人(人) (rén, "man") + 東(東) (dōng, "bag") =
    - a man carrying a bag ->
    - 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") added to show the bag-carrying man is on the ground ->
    - current form shows heaviness
  - **interpretation:** This character combines the meaning of a person carrying a burden or bag, emphasizing the weight (heavy) of the load, with the semantic reinforcement of standing on the ground. This visually conveys the idea of heaviness.
- **examples:**
  - 这个箱子很重(這個箱子很重)。
    - Zhège xiāngzi hěn zhòng.
    - This box is very heavy.
  - 我挑水井水时(我挑水井水時)，感觉瓶子异常重(感覺瓶子異常重)。
    - Wǒ tiāo shuǐjǐng shuǐ shí, gǎnjué píngzi yìcháng zhòng.
    - While I was drawing water from the well, I felt that the bottle was unusually heavy.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重) → 人(人)
- **definition:** man
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg ->
    - visual representation of a person
  - **interpretation:** The character 人(人) (rén, 'person') effectively uses simple lines to depict the essential form of a human, making it immediately recognizable and intuitive as meaning 'person.'
- **examples:**
  - 他是个好人(他是個好人)。
    - Tā shì gè hǎo rén.
    - He is a good person.
  - 每个人都有责任(每個人都有責任)，为社会作出贡献(為社會作出貢獻)。
    - Měi gè rén dōu yǒu zérèn, wèi shèhuì zuòchū gòngxiàn.
    - Every person has a responsibility to contribute to society.
  - 人在旅途中(人在旅途中)，心灵获得了成长(心靈獲得了成長)。
    - Rén zài lǚtú zhōng, xīnlíng huòdé le chéngzhǎng.
    - People gain growth along their journey.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重) → 東(東)

- **components:**
  - 束
    - shù

  - 橐
    - tuó

  - **description:**
    - Originally borrowed from 束(束) (shù, 'bundle') for sound similarity with 橐(橐) (tuó, 'bag') ->
    - a horizontal stroke added to differentiate 東(東) (dōng, 'east') ->
    - final form
  - **interpretation:** 東(東) (dōng) was adapted from existing characters to convey its phonetic sound. It was visually modified to create a unique form, aiding differentiation from related or sound-alike characters.

    - Wǒ mǎi le gè xīn dōng.

    - Tā bǎ dōng fàng zài zhuō shàng, zhǔnbèi qù lǚxíng.
    - He put the bag on the table, preparing to travel.
### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重) → 東(東) → 束(束)
- **definition:** bundle
- **pinyin:** shù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a bundle of sticks tied together
  - **interpretation:** The character 束(束) (shù, 'bundle') visually represents a group of items, such as sticks or reeds, that have been gathered and tied tightly together. This depiction is direct and intuitive for conveying the idea of a bundle.
- **examples:**
  - 他拎着一束鲜花(他拎著一束鮮花)。
    - Tā līn zhe yī shù xiānhuā.
    - He is carrying a bundle of fresh flowers.
  - 园丁修剪完花朵后(園丁修剪完花朵後)，将它们整理成一束(將它們整理成一束)。
    - Yuándīng xiūjiǎn wán huāduǒ hòu, jiāng tāmen zhěnglǐ chéng yī shù.
    - After trimming the flowers, the gardener arranged them into a bundle.
  - 小贩把蔬菜捆成一束(小販把蔬菜捆成一束)，然后去市场出售(然後去市場出售)。
    - Xiǎofàn bǎ shūcài kǔn chéng yī shù, ránhòu qù shìchǎng chūshòu.
    - The vendor bundled the vegetables and then went to the market to sell them.

  - **description:**

    - bag-like object ->

The character represents the concept of a 'bag' by visually incorporating the shape of a bag and using 石(石) to aid pronunciation.

### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重) → 東(東) → 橐(橐) → 石(石)
- **definition:** stone
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a stone beneath a cliff, where the upper part originally looked like a cliff (厂) but was distorted into 丆 over time.
  - **interpretation:** The character 石(shí, 'stone') visually represents a stone in a natural setting, highlighting the element of a cliff or mountain. Its visual design aims to reflect the appearance of rocks lodged or embedded in a mountainous or cliff-like setting.

  - 他在河边发现一块石(他在河邊發現一塊石)。

  - 孩子们喜欢堆石(孩子們喜歡堆石)，玩得开心(玩得開心)。
    - Háizimen xǐhuān duī shí, wán de kāixīn.

### 运动(運動) → 动(動) → 重(重) → 土(土)

    - Yuànzi lǐ de tǔ, shìhé zhòng huā.
    - The soil in the yard is suitable for planting flowers.

- **definition:** spray

- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
  - 賁
    - bēn
    - related to "decorate"
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic 賁(賁) (bēn, related to "decorate") =
    - sound coming from the mouth ->
    - spray
  - **interpretation:** The character 噴(噴) (pēn, "spray") combines the semantic element 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") with the phonetic element 賁(賁) (bēn), suggesting the action of emitting something like spray or mist from the mouth.
  - **simplification:** 噴(噴) -> 喷(噴): 壴(壴) (zhù, "drum") replaced by 巾(巾) (jīn, "towel") for a simpler phonetic match.

  - 水龙头在下雨时(水龍頭在下雨時)，不断喷出清水(不斷噴出清水)。
    - Shuǐ lóngtóu zài xià yǔ shí, bù duàn pēn chū qīng shuǐ.
    - The faucet continuously sprays clear water during the rain.
### 喷(噴) → 口(口)
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** The character 口(kǒu, 'mouth') is a straightforward pictogram that visually represents an open mouth. It is a fundamental character in the Chinese language, often used both as an independent word and as a component in more complex characters, lending a semantic association to ideas relating to speech, openings, or enclosures.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，大声喊叫(大聲喊叫)。

    - He opened his mouth and shouted loudly.
  - 这口饭入口即化(這口飯入口即化)。
    - Zhè kǒu fàn rùkǒu jíhuà.
    - This mouthful of food melts in your mouth.
  - 小女孩咬了一口苹果(小女孩咬了一口蘋果)，露出甜美的笑容(露出甜美的笑容)。
    - Xiǎo nǚhái yǎole yī kǒu píngguǒ, lùchū tiánměi de xiàoróng.

### 喷(噴) → 賁(賁)
- **definition:** related to "decorate"
- **pinyin:** bēn
- **components:**
  - 卉
    - huì
    - plant
  - 貝
    - bèi
    - cowry
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - Phonetic: 卉(卉) (huì, 'plant') + Semantic: 貝(貝) (bèi, 'cowry') ->
    - loaned for 奔(奔) (bēn, 'rush') ->
    - used for 'decorate'
  - **interpretation:** Originally, 賁(bēn) used 貝(貝) ('cowry') symbolizing valuable decoration and paired with phonetic 卉(卉) ('plant'). It was borrowed early on to represent 奔(奔) ('rush'), diversifying its meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 他賁飾了院子(他賁飾了院子)，使之焕然一新(使之煥然一新)。
    - Tā bēn shì le yuànzi, shǐ zhī huànrán yī xīn.
    - He decorated the courtyard, making it look completely renewed.
  - 节日来临时(節日來臨時)，市集被彩灯賁耀(市集被彩燈賁耀)。
    - Jiérì láilín shí, shìjí bèi cǎidēng bēn yào.
    - When the festival arrived, the market was brilliantly decorated with colorful lights.

## Wuchang Uprising
### Wǔchāng Qǐyì
---
- **definition:** Wuchang Uprising
- **pinyin:** Wǔchāng Qǐyì
- **components:**
  - 武昌
    - wǔchāng
    - military; prosperous
  - 起义(起義)
    - qǐyì
    - rise; righteous
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 武(武) (wǔ, "military"), 昌(昌) (chāng, "prosperous"); 起(起) (qǐ, "rise"), 义(義) (yì, "righteousness")
  - **interpretation:** The 武昌起义 (武昌起義) (Wǔchāng Qǐyì, "Wuchang Uprising") refers to the military uprising that began in Wuchang, leading to the fall of the Qing Dynasty and the establishment of the Republic of China in 1911. The name signifies a "prosperous" beginning (昌) of a "righteous" movement (义) to "rise" (起) against the existing regime with a "military" (武) effort.
  - **simplification:** 武昌起义
- **examples:**
  - 1911年爆发了武昌起义(1911年爆發了武昌起義)。
    - 1911 nián bào fā le Wǔchāng Qǐyì.
    - The Wuchang Uprising erupted in 1911.

### sòng qiūbō

- **definition:** cast amorous glances
- **pinyin:** sòng qiūbō
- **components:**
  - 送
    - sòng
    - send; deliver; give as a gift; see off
  - 秋波
    - qiūbō
    - autumn wave; flirtatious glance
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 送(送) (sòng, "send") + 秋波(秋波) (qiūbō, "autumn wave")
  - **interpretation:** The phrase 送秋波 (sòng qiūbō) metaphorically means to cast amorous glances. 秋波(秋波) (qiūbō, "autumn wave") refers to the soft and gentle look in one's eyes, evoking the idea of a calm autumn scene or a gentle wave, often used in poetry to describe a flirtatious or enchanting gaze. By combining it with 送(送) (sòng, "send"), it creates the meaning of sending or directing such gazes toward someone.
- **examples:**
  - 她在晚会中送秋波(她在晚會中送秋波)，让他心动(讓他心動)。

  - 帅哥见到她便送秋波(帥哥見到她便送秋波)，悄悄表达心意(悄悄表達心意)。
    - Shuài gē jiàn dào tā biàn sòng qiūbō, qiāoqiāo biǎodá xīnyì.
    - The handsome guy, upon seeing her, cast amorous glances, subtly expressing his feelings.
  - 在音乐会间隙，他悄悄送秋波(在音樂會間隙，他悄悄送秋波)，引起了她的注意(引起了她的注意)。
    - Zài yīnyuèhuì jiànxì, tā qiāoqiāo sòng qiūbō, yǐnqǐ le tā de zhùyì.
    - During the intermission of the concert, he quietly cast amorous glances, catching her attention.

- **definition:** Chinese knot

    - zhōng

  - 国(國)
    - guó
    - country; nation
  - 结(結)

    - knot; tie; bond
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 中(中) (zhōng, "middle") + 国(國) (guó, "country") + 结(結) (jié, "knot")
  - **interpretation:** 中国结(中國結) (zhōngguó jié, "Chinese knot") refers to the traditional decorative knotting art from China, symbolizing unity, harmony, and eternity. These knots often serve as cultural symbols and are popular in art, fashion, and festivals.
- **examples:**
  - 这个中国结很精美(這個中國結很精美)。

  - 她佩戴中国结(她佩戴中國結)，庆祝节日(慶祝節日)。
    - Tā pèidài Zhōngguó jié, qìngzhù jiérì.
    - She wears a Chinese knot to celebrate the festival.
  - 老师讲述中国结的故事(老師講述中國結的故事)，引来学生的兴趣(引來學生的興趣)。
    - Lǎoshī jiǎngshù Zhōngguó jié de gùshì, yǐnlái xuéshēng de xìngqù.
    - The teacher told the story of the Chinese knot, arousing the students' interest.

- **definition:** etymology
- **pinyin:** cíyuán
- **components:**
  - 词(詞)
    - cí
    - word; phrase; expression
  - 源
    - yuán
    - origin; source; fountainhead
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 詞(词) (cí, "word") refers to words or expressions, while 源(源) (yuán, "origin") indicates the source or origin of something.
  - **interpretation:** 詞源(词源) (cíyuán, "etymology") combines 詞(词) (cí, "word") with 源(源) (yuán, "origin") to signify the study or origin of words. It reflects an investigation into how words have developed and where they come from, aligning with the Western concept of etymology.
  - **simplification:** Converted to simplified characters: 詞 to 词
- **examples:**
  - 词源研究十分重要(詞源研究十分重要)。
    - Cíyuán yánjiū shífēn zhòngyào.
    - The study of etymology is very important.
  - 我从词源中了解单词的历史(我從詞源中了解單詞的歷史)。
    - Wǒ cóng cíyuán zhōng liǎojiě dāncí de lìshǐ.
    - I learn about the history of words from their etymology.
  - 他对词源感兴趣(他對詞源感興趣)，希望找到更多例子(希望找到更多例子)。
    - Tā duì cíyuán gǎn xìngqù, xīwàng zhǎodào gèng duō lìzi.
    - He is interested in etymology and hopes to find more examples.
### 词源(詞源) → 词(詞)
- **definition:** word; phrase; expression
- **pinyin:** cí
- **components:**
  - 讠(言)
    - yán
    - speech
  - 司
    - sī
    - manage
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - semantic: 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic: 司(司) (sī, "manage") =
    - word or term relating to speech ->
    - simplified by replacing 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") ->
    - final form 词(詞)
  - **interpretation:** The character 词(詞) (cí, "word; term") combines the speech radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 司(司) (sī, "manage") to indicate a managed or structured form of speech, i.e., a word or term. The simplified form retains this concept, making writing faster with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") being a cursive form of the speech radical.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by changing the full radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") to its cursive form 讠(讠) (yán, "speech"), facilitating quicker writing while retaining the original meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 这个词意义丰富(這個詞意義豐富)。
    - Zhè ge cí yìyì fēngfù.
    - This word has a rich meaning.
  - 诗歌中的每个词都富有韵律(詩歌中的每個詞都富有韻律)，展现了作者的才华(展現了作者的才華)。

- **pinyin:** yuè
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a crescent moon
  - **interpretation:** The character 月(yuè, "moon") is a pictographic representation of a crescent moon, straightforwardly capturing the curved shape often associated with the moon's appearance. Though interchangeable with 夕 (xī, "evening") in the past, it distinctly represents the moon in this usage.
- **examples:**
  - 夜空挂着明月(夜空掛著明月)。
    - Yè kōng guà zhe míng yuè.
    - The bright moon hangs in the night sky.
  - 人们赏月(人們賞月)，寄托相思(寄託相思)。
    - Rén men shǎng yuè, jì tuō xiāng sī.
    - People enjoy the moon, expressing their longing.
### 江湖(江湖) → 湖(湖) → 胡(胡) → 古(古)
- **definition:** ancient
- **pinyin:** gǔ
- **components:**
  - 十
    - shí
    - shield
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogram
  - **description:**
    - 十 (shí, "shield") + 口 (kǒu, "mouth") =
    - concept of "strong, firm" like a shield ->
    - original meaning of 固
  - **interpretation:** 古(gǔ, "ancient") combines a shield and a mouth, symbolizing the strength and firmness of traditions carried through speech. This original strong or firm concept eventually extended to refer to something ancient, as traditions tend to become firmly established over time.
- **examples:**
  - 古书记录着智慧(古書記錄著智慧)。
    - Gǔ shū jìlù zhe zhìhuì.
    - Ancient books record wisdom.
  - 我们参观了一个古镇(我們參觀了一個古鎮)，体验历史韵味(體驗歷史韻味)。
    - Wǒmen cānguān le yīgè gǔ zhèn, tǐyàn lìshǐ yùnwèi.
    - We visited an ancient town and experienced its historical charm.
  - 古建筑诉说着过去(古建築訴說著過去)。
    - Gǔ jiànzhú sùshuō zhe guòqù.
    - Ancient architecture tells the stories of the past.
### 江湖(江湖) → 湖(湖) → 胡(胡) → 古(古) → 十(十)
- **definition:** shield
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Original vertical stroke ->
    - later horizontal stroke added ->
    - forms a cross ->
    - represents 'ten'
  - **interpretation:** The character 十(shí, 'ten') represents the number ten with a cross shape that could be seen as tally marks. It evolved from a simple vertical stroke to a cross by adding a horizontal stroke, symbolizing a complete set of ten.
- **examples:**
  - 我有十本书(我有十本書)。
    - Wǒ yǒu shí běn shū.
    - I have ten books.
  - 花园里有十棵树(花園裡有十棵樹)，景色十分优美(景色十分優美)。
    - Huāyuán lǐ yǒu shí kē shù, jǐngsè shífēn yōuměi.
    - There are ten trees in the garden, and the scenery is very beautiful.
  - 十年磨一剑(十年磨一劍)。
    - Shí nián mó yī jiàn.
    - It takes ten years of practice to hone a sword.
### 江湖(江湖) → 湖(湖) → 胡(胡) → 古(古) → 口(口)
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** The character 口(kǒu, 'mouth') is a straightforward pictogram that visually represents an open mouth. It is a fundamental character in the Chinese language, often used both as an independent word and as a component in more complex characters, lending a semantic association to ideas relating to speech, openings, or enclosures.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，大声喊叫(大聲喊叫)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, dàshēng hǎnjiào.
    - He opened his mouth and shouted loudly.
  - 这口饭入口即化(這口飯入口即化)。
    - Zhè kǒu fàn rùkǒu jíhuà.
    - This mouthful of food melts in your mouth.
  - 小女孩咬了一口苹果(小女孩咬了一口蘋果)，露出甜美的笑容(露出甜美的笑容)。
    - Xiǎo nǚhái yǎole yī kǒu píngguǒ, lùchū tiánměi de xiàoróng.
    - The little girl took a bite of the apple and smiled sweetly.

## showroom
### yàngbǎnjiān
---
- **definition:** showroom
- **pinyin:** yàngbǎnjiān
- **components:**
  - 样(樣)
    - yàng
    - appearance; shape; manner
  - 板
    - bǎn
    - board; plank; model
  - 间(間)
    - jiān
    - room; between; space
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") + 板(板) (bǎn, "board; model") + 间(間) (jiān, "room")
  - **interpretation:** The term 样板间(樣板間) (yàngbǎnjiān, "showroom") combines 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") to suggest an example or display, with 板(板) (bǎn, "model"), indicating a model or template, and 间(間) (jiān, "room"), referring to the physical space. Together, they describe a room that displays a model or example, often used in real estate to exhibit how a finished living space might look.
  - **simplification:** 样板间 is the simplified form of 樣板間.
- **examples:**
  - 他带我们参观样板间(他帶我們參觀樣板間)。
    - Tā dài wǒmen cānguān yàngbǎnjiān.
    - He took us to visit the showroom.
  - 新的样板间装修精美(新的樣板間裝修精美)，吸引了很多顾客(吸引了很多顧客)。
    - Xīn de yàngbǎnjiān zhuāngxiū jīngměi, xīyǐn le hěn duō gùkè.
    - The new showroom is exquisitely decorated and attracts many customers.
### 样板间(樣板間) → 样(樣)

- **components:**

    - combination of the semantic 'wood' and the phonetic contribution of 'yàng' ->
    - appearance or shape
  - **interpretation:** The character 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") combines the component 木(木) (mù, "wood") to hint at material or form, with 羕(羕) (yàng, "river") providing the phonetic aspect. This suggests something resembling or taking shape like wood, which extends metaphorically to various forms or appearances.
- **examples:**

    - phonetic element combined with the idea of flowing water ->

  - **interpretation:** The character 羊(yáng, 'sheep') visually represents the head of a sheep or ram, capturing the animal's distinctive features. It serves as a straightforward pictogram, portraying one of the common animals in ancient agrarian societies.

This phono-semantic compound effectively captures the concept of a 'board' or 'plank,' as these are typically wooden items.

- **etymology:**

  - **description:**

    - light peeking through a gate ->
    - space/interval
  - **interpretation:** The character combines 門(門) (mén, "gate") as the semantic component, suggesting separation or division, with 日(日) (rì, "sun") as the phonetic component, invoking the image of sunlight streaming through a gap. This evokes the idea of a 'space' or 'interval' as it is visible between two gates or within an enclosure.

### 样板间(樣板間) → 间(間) → 门(門)
- **definition:** gate
- **pinyin:** mén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - 門(門) (mén, "gate") depicts a gate ->
    - simplified to 门(门) (mén, "gate")
  - **interpretation:** The character 门(門) (mén, "gate") represents the image of a double-sided gate. It simplifies to 门(门) but retains the depiction of an entrance or gateway.

    - Qǐng nǐ cóng zhè shàn mén(請你從這扇門) jìnlái(進來)，bǎ xiézi(把鞋子) tuōdiào(脫掉)。
    - Please come in through this door and take off your shoes.
  - 夜深了(夜深了)，只有微弱的光从门缝里泄出(只有微弱的光從門縫裡洩出)。

    - It's late at night, and only a faint light seeps through the gap in the door.
### 样板间(樣板間) → 间(間) → 日(日)
- **definition:** sun
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts the sun; a dot or line added in the center to distinguish from similar characters e.g. 囗
  - **interpretation:** As a pictogram, 日(rì, 'sun') directly represents the sun. In ancient times, the added dot helped visually differentiate it from other characters. This is analogous to the astronomical symbol ☉ and Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳, both depicting the sun.
- **examples:**
  - 晨曦来临时(晨曦來臨時)，日出东方(日出東方)。

  - 温暖的日光洒满大地(溫暖的日光灑滿大地)。

    - The warm sunlight spreads over the earth.
  - 中午时分(中午時分)，日高挂天(日高掛天)。
    - Zhōngwǔ shífēn, rì gāo guà tiān.
    - At noon, the sun hangs high in the sky.

## Spring Festival
### Chūn Jié
---
- **definition:** Spring Festival
- **pinyin:** Chūn Jié
- **components:**

  - 节(節)
    - jié
    - festival; node; joint; segment
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 春(春) (chūn, "spring") and 節(節) (jié, "festival") combine directly to mean "Spring Festival." 春(春) (chūn, "spring") refers to the season marking new beginnings and renewal, and 節(節) (jié, "festival") signifies a celebratory time or occasion. The Spring Festival is a major holiday in Chinese culture, celebrated with various customs and traditions.
  - **interpretation:** The combination of 春(春) (chūn, "spring") and 節(節) (jié, "festival") makes sense as the festival is celebrated at the beginning of the new lunar year during the spring season, marking renewal and new beginnings.
- **examples:**
  - 春节是中国最重要的节日(春節是中國最重要的節日)。
    - Chūn Jié shì Zhōngguó zuì zhòngyào de jiérì.
    - The Spring Festival is the most important festival in China.
  - 家人团聚过春节(家人團聚過春節)，共享美食庆佳节(共享美食慶佳節)。
    - Jiārén tuánjù guò Chūn Jié, gòngxiǎng měishí qìng jiājié.
    - Family gathers during the Spring Festival and enjoys delicious food to celebrate the holiday.
### 春节(春節) → 春(春)
- **definition:** spring
- **pinyin:** chūn
- **components:**
  - ⾠(艸)
    - cǎo
    - grass
  - 日
    - rì
    - sun
  - 屯
    - zhūn
    - sprout

  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**

    - sun shining on grass with sprouts ->
    - spring
  - **interpretation:** The character 春(春) (chūn, "spring") involves elements representing natural growth and revival: grass, sun, and sprouts together illustrate the vibrant growth occurring in springtime.
- **examples:**
  - 春天来了(春天來了)。
    - Chūntiān láile.
    - Spring has arrived.
  - 春天来了(春天來了)，万物复苏(萬物復蘇)。

  - 春光明媚(春光明媚)，人们心情愉快(人們心情愉快)。

Together, 练习(練習) (liànxí) means "practice" in the sense of engaging in activities to improve skill through repetition and learning.

### 词汇(詞彙) → 词(詞)
- **definition:** word; term
- **pinyin:** cí
- **components:**
  - 讠(言)
    - yán
    - speech
  - 司
    - sī
    - manage
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - semantic: 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic: 司(司) (sī, "manage") =
    - word or term relating to speech ->
    - simplified by replacing 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") ->
    - final form 词(詞)
  - **interpretation:** The character 词(詞) (cí, "word; term") combines the speech radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 司(司) (sī, "manage") to indicate a managed or structured form of speech, i.e., a word or term. The simplified form retains this concept, making writing faster with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") being a cursive form of the speech radical.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by changing the full radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") to its cursive form 讠(讠) (yán, "speech"), facilitating quicker writing while retaining the original meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 这个词意义丰富(這個詞意義豐富)。
    - Zhè ge cí yìyì fēngfù.
    - This word has a rich meaning.
  - 诗歌中的每个词都富有韵律(詩歌中的每個詞都富有韻律)，展现了作者的才华(展現了作者的才華)。
    - Shīgē zhōng de měi ge cí dōu fùyǒu yùnlǜ, zhǎnxiànle zuòzhě de cáihuá.

  - **description:** Depicts a curved line with a dot, symbolizing speech or words

- **examples:**
  - 汉字中的讠构件(漢字中的言構件)，常出现在有关话语的字中(常出現在有關話語的字中)。
    - Hànzì zhōng de yán gòujiàn, cháng chūxiàn zài yǒuguān huàyǔ de zì zhōng.
    - The 讠 component in Chinese characters often appears in characters related to speech.
  - 古人重视讠之力量(古人重視言之力量)，认为言传身教胜过万言(認為言傳身教勝過萬言)。
    - Gǔrén zhòngshì yán zhī lìliàng, rènwéi yán chuán shēnjiào shèngguò wànyán.
    - Ancient people valued the power of speech, believing that teaching by example was superior to a thousand words.
  - 含讠字形的汉字(含言字形的漢字)，通常与言语表达密切相关(通常與言語表達密切相關)。
    - Hán yán zìxíng de hànzì, tōngcháng yǔ yányǔ biǎodá mìqiè xiāngguān.
    - Chinese characters with the 讠 radical are usually closely associated with speech expression.

### 饮料(飲料) → 饮(飲)
- **definition:** drink; swallow

    - shí
    - to eat
  - 欠
    - qiàn
    - yawn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 酉(酉) (yǒu, "bottle") + 人(人) (rén, "person") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") ->
    - person bending over a bottle to drink ->
    - bronze script: 口 separate, become 今(今) (jīn), rest of body becomes 欠(欠) (qiàn) ->
    - final: 食(食) (shí, "eat") + 欠(欠) (qiàn, "yawn") ->
    - 飲(飲)
  - **interpretation:** The character illustrates the act of drinking as a person bent over a bottle. Over time, the depiction was stylized, repurposing 食(食) (shí, "eat") and 欠(欠) (qiàn, "yawn") to retain the original meaning phonetically and semantically.
  - **simplification:** In simplified Chinese, 食(食) (shí, "eat") is retained and 欠(欠) (qiàn, "yawn") remains, forming 饮. The character's form was likely adjusted for ease while maintaining pronunciation and meaning.
- **examples:**

'二代' (èrdài, "second generation") is often used in Chinese to denote the children or descendants of a certain group, and 官(官) (guān, "official") specifies that these are the offspring of people in official positions. The phrase carries connotations of privilege and inherited status in contemporary China.

### 高丽菜(高麗菜) → 高麗(高麗)
- **definition:** Korea; Goryeo dynasty
- **pinyin:** gāolí
- **components:**
  - 高
    - gāo
    - high; tall
  - 麗
    - lí
    - beautiful; magnificent
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 高(高) (gāo, "high") + 麗(麗) (lí, "beautiful")
  - **interpretation:** 高麗(高麗) (gāolí) refers to the Goryeo dynasty, a historical Korean kingdom lasting from 918 to 1392. The name is derived from 고구려(Goguryeo), one of the Three Kingdoms of Korea, and was adopted as a mark of pride and distinctiveness. 高(高) (gāo, "high") and 麗(麗) (lí, "beautiful") highlight the elevated and beautiful nature attributed to the kingdom.
- **examples:**

- **definition:** be in a daze
- **pinyin:** fādāi
- **components:**

    - fā
    - to send out; to emit; to issue; to develop
  - 呆
    - dāi
    - dazed; dumb; blank; dull
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 发(發) (fā, "to send out; to emit") refers to the idea of expressing or emanating something, often used with an action projection. 呆(呆) (dāi, "dazed; dumb") describes a state of being stunned or unresponsive, often with a lack of awareness.
  - **interpretation:** The combination 发呆(發呆) (fādāi, "be in a daze") captures the state of mind in which one seems to emit or project a lack of awareness, appearing mentally absent or in a reverie.
- **examples:**
  - 他正在发呆(他正在發呆)。
    - Tā zhèngzài fādāi.
    - He is in a daze.
  - 听到这消息时(聽到這消息時)，他发呆了(他發呆了)。
    - Tīng dào zhè xiāoxī shí, tā fādāile.
    - When he heard the news, he was in a daze.
  - 工作太累时发呆(工作太累時發呆)，让他错过了重要的会议(讓他錯過了重要的會議)。
    - Gōngzuò tài lèi shí fādāi, ràng tā cuòguòle zhòngyào de huìyì.
    - Being in a daze from too much work made him miss an important meeting.
### 发呆(發呆) → 发(發)

    - evolved into phonetic component 癹(癹) (bá) ->
    - final form as phono-semantic

### 无法(無法) → 无(無)

The origin of 无 is uncertain, and it might have evolved as a variant of other characters like 元(元) (yuán, 'origin'), 天(天) (tiān, 'heaven'), or 堯(堯) (yáo, 'legendary ruler'). Adopted officially in simplified script in 1956 by the PRC.

### 开心(開心) → 开(開)
- **definition:** open; start

- **components:**

  - 一
    - yī
    - latch or pole
  - 廾
    - gǒng
    - pair of hands
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:**
    - 門(門) (mén, 'door') + 一(一) (yī, 'latch or wooden pole') + 廾(廾) (gǒng, 'pair of hands') =
    - hands opening a latched door ->
    - open; simplified to 开 by removing 門
  - **interpretation:** The traditional character 開 shows a pair of hands opening a latched door. In the simplified form 开, the representation of 門. (door) was removed to streamline writing while maintaining the essence of the action of 'opening'.
  - **simplification:** Simplified 开 from 開 by removing the 門 (mén, 'door') to keep the focus on the action with 干 (gān) representing the trunks or latches.
- **examples:**
  - 我开车去上班(我開車去上班)。
    - Wǒ kāichē qù shàngbān.
    - I drive to work.
  - 花儿开得很灿烂(花兒開得很燦爛)。

    - The flowers are blooming brilliantly.
  - 他打开窗户(他打開窗戶)，迎进清新的空气(迎進清新的空氣)。
    - Tā dǎkāi chuānghù, yíng jìn qīngxīn de kōngqì.
    - He opens the window to let in the fresh air.

### 热敏(熱敏) → 热(熱)

    - semiotic phonetic 执(埶)
  - **interpretation:** The character 熱 (rè) in its traditional form combines 埶(埶) (yì, "art") which phonetically hints at the pronunciation and 灬(灬) indicating fire, to designate an artfully controlled fire representing heat. The fire radical emphasizes the concept of heat and heat generation.

### 全素(全素) → 素(素) → 粟(粟)
- **definition:** millet
- **pinyin:** sù
- **components:**
  - 角
    - jiǎo
    - horn
  - 米
    - mǐ
    - rice
  - 西
    - xī
    - west
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Oracle bone script shows seeds → 角(角) (jiǎo, "horn") for phonetic + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") for semantic → 角 evolved to 𠧪 → further changed to 西(西) (xī, "west")
  - **interpretation:** Initially depicting seeds, 粟(sù, "millet") combined phonetic and semantic elements. 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") indicates the grain aspect, while 角(角) (jiǎo) initially added sound. Over time, the original depiction evolved through several script forms to match pronunciation changes.
- **examples:**
  - 秋天丰收时(秋天豐收時)，田野中的粟闪着金光(田野中的粟閃著金光)。
    - Qiūtiān fēngshōu shí, tiányě zhōng de sù shǎnzhe jīnguāng.
    - During the autumn harvest, the millet in the fields glimmers with golden light.
  - 农夫把粟从田里收集(農夫把粟從田裡收集)，准备储存过冬(準備儲存過冬)。
    - Nóngfū bǎ sù cóng tián lǐ shōují, zhǔnbèi chúcún guòdōng.
    - The farmer collects the millet from the fields, preparing to store it for the winter.
  - 古代诗人常以粟象征丰收(古代詩人常以粟象徵豐收)，歌颂农事的喜悦(歌頌農事的喜悅)。
    - Gǔdài shīrén cháng yǐ sù xiàngzhēng fēngshōu, gēsòng nóngshì de xǐyuè.
    - Ancient poets often used millet to symbolize a bountiful harvest, praising the joy of farming.

Although traditionally linked to the image of a bird in a nest symbolizing the setting sun, this interpretation is disputed. Instead, it reflects a simple phonetic borrowing.

## 同(同)
---
## same
### tóng
---
- **definition:** same
- **pinyin:** tóng
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - "mouth"
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Originally depicted as a pipe 筒(筒) (tǒng, "pipe") ->
    - 口 added as decoration ->
    - interpreted as mouth 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") giving orders ->
    - evolved to mean togetherness and unity
  - **interpretation:** The character 同(同) (tóng, "same; unity; together; common") originally depicted a pipe but later took on the symbolic meaning of unity, possibly influenced by the shared cooperation in activities like music or rigid group tasks. The addition of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") emphasizes communication and collaboration.
- **examples:**
  - 我们同心协力(我們同心協力)。
    - Wǒmen tóngxīn xiélì.
    - We work together with one heart and mind.
  - 他们穿着同款衣服(他們穿著同款衣服)，看起来十分整齐(看起來十分整齊)。
    - Tāmen chuānzhe tóng kuǎn yīfú, kàn qǐlái shífēn zhěngqí.
    - They are wearing the same style of clothes and look very orderly.
### 同(同) → 口(口)
- **definition:** "mouth"
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** The character 口(kǒu, 'mouth') is a straightforward pictogram that visually represents an open mouth. It is a fundamental character in the Chinese language, often used both as an independent word and as a component in more complex characters, lending a semantic association to ideas relating to speech, openings, or enclosures.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，大声喊叫(大聲喊叫)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, dàshēng hǎnjiào.
    - He opened his mouth and shouted loudly.
  - 这口饭入口即化(這口飯入口即化)。
    - Zhè kǒu fàn rùkǒu jíhuà.
    - This mouthful of food melts in your mouth.
  - 小女孩咬了一口苹果(小女孩咬了一口蘋果)，露出甜美的笑容(露出甜美的笑容)。
    - Xiǎo nǚhái yǎole yī kǒu píngguǒ, lùchū tiánměi de xiàoróng.
    - The little girl took a bite of the apple and smiled sweetly.

## 想起来(想起來)
---
## remember; recall
### xiǎngqǐlái
---
- **definition:** remember; recall
- **pinyin:** xiǎngqǐlái
- **components:**
  - 想
    - xiǎng
    - think; ponder; consider; believe
  - 起
    - qǐ
    - rise; start; initiate; stand up
  - 来(來)
    - lái
    - come; return; arrive
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:**
    - 想(想) (xiǎng, "think") + 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") + 來(來) (lái, "come") =
    - to cause thoughts to rise and come back, meaning to remember or recall.
  - **interpretation:** The word 想起来(想起來) (xiǎngqǐlái, "remember; recall") combines the idea of thinking with the action of something rising up and coming back to the mind. This reflects the process of retrieving memories or thoughts that may have been forgotten.
  - **simplification:** 想起來
- **examples:**
  - 我突然想起来(我突然想起來)，朋友的生日马上到了(朋友的生日馬上到了)。
    - Wǒ túrán xiǎngqǐlái, péngyǒu de shēngrì mǎshàng dàole.
    - I suddenly remembered that my friend's birthday was coming soon.
  - 听到那首歌时(聽到那首歌時)，他想起来(他想起來)旧时的快乐(舊時的快樂)。
    - Tīngdào nà shǒu gē shí, tā xiǎngqǐlái jiùshí de kuàilè.
    - Upon hearing that song, he recalled the joy of the old days.
### 想起来(想起來) → 想(想)
- **definition:** think; ponder; consider; believe
- **pinyin:** xiǎng
- **components:**
  - 相
    - xiāng
    - appearance
  - 心
    - xīn
    - heart, mind
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - Phonetic: 相(相) (xiāng, "appearance") + Semantic: 心(心) (xīn, "heart, mind") =
    - visualizing in the mind ->
    - to think, to consider
  - **interpretation:** 想(想) (xiǎng, "think") combines the phonetic component 相(相) (xiāng, "appearance") with the semantic component 心(心) (xīn, "heart, mind") to convey the idea of visualizing or pondering something with the heart or mind. This effectively captures the essence of internal contemplation or consideration.
- **examples:**
  - 我想去图书馆(我想去圖書館)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng qù túshūguǎn.
    - I want to go to the library.
  - 妈妈想做饭(媽媽想做飯)，我们想吃中餐(我們想吃中餐)。
    - Māmā xiǎng zuò fàn, wǒmen xiǎng chī zhōngcān.
    - Mom wants to cook, and we want to eat Chinese food.
  - 他想一想(他想一想)，就决定了(就決定了)。
    - Tā xiǎng yīxiǎng, jiù juédìng le.
    - He gave it some thought, then made a decision.
### 想起来(想起來) → 想(想) → 相(相)
- **definition:** appearance
- **pinyin:** xiāng
- **components:**
  - 木
    - mù
    - tree
  - 目
    - mù
    - eye
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - Semantic: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + Phonetic: 目(目) (mù) =
    - eye on tree ->
    - to look at each other ->
    - mutual
  - **interpretation:** The character 相(xiāng, "mutual") combines 目(目) (mù, "eye") suggesting seeing or observing, with 木(木) (mù, "tree"), reflecting the idea of looking out over a distance or surveying. This is extended to mean looking at each other, thus becoming associated with mutual or reciprocal actions.
- **examples:**
  - 他们相互扶持(他們相互扶持)。
    - Tāmen xiānghù fúchí.
    - They support each other.
  - 朋友之间要相互理解(朋友之間要相互理解)，共同进步(共同進步)。
    - Péngyǒu zhījiān yào xiānghù lǐjiě, gòngtóng jìnbù.
    - Friends should understand each other and make progress together.
  - 夫妻之间应相互尊重(夫妻之間應相互尊重)。
    - Fūqī zhījiān yīng xiānghù zūnzhòng.
    - Husbands and wives should mutually respect each other.
### 想起来(想起來) → 想(想) → 相(相) → 木(木)
- **definition:** tree
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a tree with branches and roots
  - **interpretation:** The character 木(mù) depicts a tree, showing the trunk in the center and two slanting lines representing branches or roots. It directly signifies the concept of wood or a tree.
- **examples:**
  - 这把椅子的主要材料是木(這把椅子的主要材料是木)。
    - Zhè bǎ yǐzi de zhǔyào cáiliào shì mù.
    - The main material of this chair is wood.
  - 工匠精心雕刻木(工匠精心雕刻木)，制成精美家具(制成精美家具)。
    - Gōngjiàng jīngxīn diāo kè mù, zhìchéng jīngměi jiājù.
    - The craftsman carefully carved the wood, crafting exquisite furniture.
### 想起来(想起來) → 想(想) → 相(相) → 目(目)
- **definition:** eye
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a human eye, now represented and rotated 90 degrees ->
    - eye
  - **interpretation:** The character 目(mù, 'eye') is a pictogram representing a human eye. Its original orientation has changed over time, resembling an eye seen from a sideways view.
- **examples:**
  - 他的目光炯炯有神(他的目光炯炯有神)。
    - Tā de mùguāng jiǒngjiǒng yǒu shén.
    - His gaze is bright and full of spirit.
  - 她目不转睛(她目不轉睛)，注视前方(注視前方)。
    - Tā mù bù zhuǎn jīng, zhùshì qiánfāng.
    - She stared intently, gazing ahead.
  - 雄鹰展翅(雄鷹展翅)，双目炯炯看天际(雙目炯炯看天際)。
    - Xióng yīng zhǎn chì, shuāng mù jiǒngjiǒng kàn tiānjì.
    - The eagle spreads its wings, its eyes piercingly gaze at the horizon.
### 想起来(想起來) → 想(想) → 心(心)
- **definition:** heart, mind
- **pinyin:** xīn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a stylized representation of a heart
  - **interpretation:** The character 心(xīn, 'heart') visually represents the shape of a heart, emphasizing its central and essential role in both a physical and metaphorical sense.
- **examples:**
  - 他的心温暖无比(他的心溫暖無比)。
    - Tā de xīn wēnnuǎn wúbǐ.
    - His heart is incredibly warm.
  - 她把心放在艺术上(她把心放在藝術上)，追求完美(追求完美)。
    - Tā bǎ xīn fàng zài yìshù shàng, zhuīqiú wánměi.
    - She dedicates her heart to art, pursuing perfection.
  - 音乐直击心灵(音樂直擊心靈)。
    - Yīnyuè zhí jī xīnlíng.
    - Music strikes straight at the heart (soul).
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起)
- **definition:** rise; start; initiate; stand up
- **pinyin:** qǐ
- **components:**
  - 走
    - zǒu
    - walk
  - 巳
    - sì
    - sixth terrestrial branch
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - semantic: 走(走) (zǒu, "walk") + phonetic: 巳(巳) (sì, "sixth terrestrial branch") =
    - implying movement or ascent ->
    - rise, begin
  - **interpretation:** The character 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") combines 走(走) (zǒu, "walk"), indicating motion or activity, with 巳(巳) (sì, "sixth terrestrial branch"), contributing the phonetic element. This combination intuitively represents the concept of rising or beginning.
- **examples:**
  - 我早上起床(我早上起床)。
    - Wǒ zǎoshang qǐ chuáng.
    - I get up in the morning.
  - 太阳升起时(太陽升起時)，世界变得明亮(世界變得明亮)。
    - Tàiyáng shēng qǐ shí, shìjiè biàn dé míngliàng.
    - When the sun rises, the world becomes bright.
  - 他鼓起勇气(他鼓起勇氣)，面对挑战(面對挑戰)。
    - Tā gǔ qǐ yǒngqì, miànduì tiǎozhàn.
    - He mustered his courage to face the challenges.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走)
- **definition:** walk
- **pinyin:** zǒu
- **components:**
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - foot
  - 夭
    - yāo
    - young
  - 土
    - tǔ
    - earth
  - 龰
    - yuè
    - walking
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Running man (original depiction) + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") added later ->
    - top 夭(夭) (yāo, "young") simplified to 土(土) (tǔ, "earth"), bottom stylized as 龰 ->
    - modern 走
  - **interpretation:** The character originally depicted a man running, with an added foot to emphasize movement. Over time, elements like the top 夭(夭) were simplified to 土(土), and the bottom was stylized to 龰, although they are unrelated to the original meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 看到前方火光时(看到前方火光時)，他急忙走向安全地带(他急忙走向安全地帶)。
    - Kàndào qiánfāng huǒguāng shí, tā jímáng zǒu xiàng ānquán dìdài.
    - When he saw the firelight ahead, he hurriedly ran toward safety.
  - 比赛开始后(比賽開始後)，选手们奋力走向终点(選手們奮力走向終點)。
    - Bǐsài kāishǐ hòu, xuǎnshǒu men fènlì zǒu xiàng zhōngdiǎn.
    - After the race began, the contestants ran towards the finish line.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 止(止)
- **definition:** foot
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **components:**
  - 趾
    - zhǐ
    - foot
  - 龰
    - yù
    - stylized feet
  - 手
    - shǒu
    - hand
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Original: Foot pointing up with 3 toes and a sole ->
    - Stylized as 龰 ->
    - Derivative 趾 refers to original 'foot' meaning
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicting a footprint with toes and a sole, 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") represents the foot. The character's form resembles a foot with three toes, analogous to how the hand is represented with fingers in other characters.
- **examples:**
  - 他受伤的止需要静养(他受傷的止需要靜養)。
    - Tā shòu shāng de zhǐ xū yào jìng yǎng.
    - His injured foot needs adequate rest.
  - 他走路时小心谨慎(他走路時小心謹慎)，因为止若受伤便难前行(因爲止若受傷便難前行)。
    - Tā zǒu lù shí xiǎo xīn jǐn shèn, yīn wèi zhǐ ruò shòu shāng biàn nán qián xíng.
    - He walks carefully because if his foot gets injured, it becomes difficult to move forward.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 止(止) → 趾(趾)
- **definition:** foot
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **components:**
  - 足
    - zú
    - foot
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - stop
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 足(足) (zú, "foot") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") =
    - semantic: foot + phonetic: stop ->
    - toe
  - **interpretation:** The character combines 足(足) (zú, "foot") as the semantic indicator and 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") as the phonetic component to represent the idea of a 'toe,' which is a part of the foot.
- **examples:**
  - 他的趾因寒冷而僵硬了(他的趾因寒冷而僵硬了)。
    - tā de zhǐ yīn hánlěng ér jiāngyìng le.
    - His toe became stiff due to the cold.
  - 我走路时(我走路時)，不小心扭到了趾(不小心扭到了趾)。
    - wǒ zǒulù shí, bù xiǎoxīn niǔ dào le zhǐ.
    - While I was walking, I accidentally twisted my toe.
  - 古代剑客战斗时(古代劍客戰鬥時)，常因疏忽伤及趾(常因疏忽傷及趾)。
    - gǔdài jiànkè zhàndòu shí, cháng yīn shūhū shāng jí zhǐ.
    - Ancient swordsmen often injured their toes due to carelessness during battles.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 止(止) → 趾(趾) → 足(足)
- **definition:** foot
- **pinyin:** zú
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts a leg ->
    - originally depicted as ⽦ ->
    - represents 'foot'
  - **interpretation:** The character 足(zú, 'foot') is a pictographic representation of a human leg, which directly portrays the concept of a 'foot'. The pictographic origin emphasizes its fundamental meaning in the language.
- **examples:**
  - 他受伤后(他受傷後)，他的足不能动(他的足不能動)。
    - tā shòushāng hòu, tā de zú bù néng dòng。
    - After he was injured, his foot couldn't move.
  - 小明打球时(小明打球時)，不小心扭伤了足(不小心扭傷了足)。
    - xiǎo míng dǎ qiú shí, bù xiǎoxīn niǔ shāng le zú。
    - When Xiaoming was playing ball, he accidentally twisted his foot.
  - 我每天锻炼足部(我每天鍛鍊足部)。
    - wǒ měitiān duànliàn zúbù。
    - I exercise my foot muscles every day.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 止(止) → 龰(龰)
- **definition:** stylized feet
- **pinyin:** yù
- **components:**
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - foot
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Depicts stylized feet ->
    - original form of 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot")
  - **interpretation:** The character 龰(yù) is a pictogram representing a stylized version of feet, derived from the original character 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot"). This pictogram shows the shape of a footprint and was historically used to symbolize the concept of a foot. It is characterized by its depiction of three toes and a sole, similar to representations seen in other characters like 爪(爪) (zhǎo, "claw") and 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch"), which also depict human extremities with similar features.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 止(止) → 手(手)
- **definition:** hand
- **pinyin:** shǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a hand with fingers; top stroke is a bent over middle finger, horizontal strokes represent fingers
  - **interpretation:** The character 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") is a direct pictorial representation of a human hand with all five fingers, which distinguishes it from similar characters representing claws or simplified fingers. This visually conveys its meaning as a hand clearly.
- **examples:**
  - 他用手写字(他用手寫字)。
    - Tā yòng shǒu xiě zì.
    - He writes with his hand.
  - 妈妈牵着我的手走路(媽媽牽著我的手走路)。
    - Māmā qiān zhe wǒ de shǒu zǒu lù.
    - Mom holds my hand while walking.
  - 他的手很温暖(他的手很溫暖)，带给我力量(帶給我力量)。
    - Tā de shǒu hěn wēn nuǎn, dài gěi wǒ lìliàng.
    - His hand is very warm, giving me strength.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 夭(夭)
- **definition:** young
- **pinyin:** yāo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:**

    - energetic, young
  - **interpretation:** The character 夭(yāo) ("young") visually represents someone leaning forward in a motion that suggests energy and vitality associated with youthfulness. This imagery aligns with the concept of being lively or young.
- **examples:**

  - 小女孩还夭(夭)，充满无限活力(充滿無限活力)。
    - Xiǎo nǚhái hái yāo, chōngmǎn wúxiàn huólì。
    - The little girl is still young, filled with boundless energy.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 走(走) → 土(土)
- **definition:** earth
- **pinyin:** tǔ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a mound of earth
  - **interpretation:** The character 土(tǔ, "earth") visually represents a mound or piece of land, with a horizontal line indicating the surface and a vertical line the height of the mound. It's a straightforward depiction of earth or soil.
- **examples:**
  - 农民耕土(農民耕土)，种出丰收(種出豐收)。
    - Nóngmín gēng tǔ, zhòng chū fēngshōu.
    - Farmers cultivate the earth and harvest abundantly.
  - 院子里的土(院子裡的土)，适合种花(適合種花)。
    - Yuànzi lǐ de tǔ, shìhé zhòng huā.
    - The soil in the yard is suitable for planting flowers.
### 想起来(想起來) → 起(起) → 巳(巳)
- **definition:** sixth terrestrial branch
- **pinyin:** sì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a fetus or snake.
  - **interpretation:** The character 巳(sì, "fetus") likely represents the shape of a fetus curled in the womb or possibly the sinuous form of a snake. This ambiguity is due to its pictographic origin, imitating the curves and forms seen in nature.
- **examples:**
  - 那小小的巳(那小小的巳)在温暖的子宫中悄然成长(在溫暖的子宮中悄然成長)。
    - Nà xiǎoxiǎo de sì zài wēnnuǎn de zǐgōng zhōng qiǎorán chéngzhǎng.
    - The tiny fetus is growing quietly in the warm womb.
  - 医生发现巳异常(醫生發現巳異常)，提醒家长早期注意(提醒家長早期注意)。
    - Yīshēng fāxiàn sì yìcháng, tíxǐng jiāzhǎng zǎoqī zhùyì.
    - The doctor found an abnormality in the fetus and urged the parents to pay early attention.
  - 母亲感受到巳微弱的心跳(母親感受到巳微弱的心跳)伴随着温柔的希望(伴隨著溫柔的希望)。
    - Mǔqīn gǎnshòudào sì wēiruò de xīntiào bànsuízhe wēnróu de xīwàng.
    - The mother felt the fetus's faint heartbeat accompanied by a gentle hope.
### 想起来(想起來) → 来(來)
- **definition:** come; return; arrive
- **pinyin:** lái
- **components:**
  - 來
    - lái
    - come
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - foot
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - Pictogram of wheat: line in middle (ear) + two lines upwards (leaves) + lines downwards (stem, roots) ->
    - borrowed for 来(來) (lái, 'come'); additional semantic components (e.g. 止 (zhǐ, 'foot')) added in Western Zhou, later removed
  - **interpretation:** 來(來) (lái, 'come') visually depicts aspects of wheat, but was phonetically borrowed early for its modern meaning. Components like 'foot' and 'walk' were historically added to clarify this borrowing, but were later omitted, indicating the character's core phonetic origin.
- **examples:**

- **definition:** reserve; book

  - **interpretation:** The word 预订(預訂) (yùdìng, "reserve; book") combines the idea of taking action in advance with the act of ordering. This concept is applied when setting aside services or items before they are needed, such as booking a hotel room or reserving a table at a restaurant.

    - He reserved a table, planning to invite friends to dine together.
  - 我们预订了演唱会门票(我們預訂了演唱會門票)，期待美好的夜晚(期待美好的夜晚)。

- **definition:** programmer (slang)

  - 农(農)
    - nóng

  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:**
    - 码(碼) (mǎ, "code; number") + 农(農) (nóng, "farmer") =
    - a humorous slang term for a programmer, suggesting someone who works hard writing lines of code like a farmer tending a field.
  - **interpretation:** The term 码农(碼農) (mǎnóng, "programmer") humorously implies that programmers tirelessly produce lines of code as farmers cultivate crops. This reflects the repetitive and labor-intensive nature of programming work.
  - **simplification:** 码: 碼, 农: 農
- **examples:**
  - 他是码农(他是碼農)。

    - Mǎnóng jiābān wǎn, shēnghuó yě bù qīngsōng.
    - The programmer works overtime until late, and life is not easy.

    - semantic of brightness/clarity from 白 (bái) plus phonetic 勺 (sháo) ->
    - possessive/attributive particle

### Qín Shǐhuáng
---
- **definition:** Qin Shi Huang (first emperor of Qin)
- **pinyin:** Qín Shǐhuáng
- **components:**
  - 秦
    - Qín
    - Qin
  - 始
    - shǐ
    - beginning; first
  - 皇
    - huáng
    - emperor; sovereign
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 秦(秦) (Qín, "Qin") refers to the Qin state, which was one of the warring states in ancient China. 始(始) (shǐ, "beginning") indicates the notion of beginning or being the first. 皇(皇) (huáng, "emperor") signifies an emperor or sovereign. Together, 秦始皇(Qín Shǐhuáng) refers to the first emperor of the unified China under the Qin dynasty.
  - **interpretation:** 秦始皇(Qín Shǐhuáng), or Emperor Qin Shi Huang, is renowned for being the first emperor to unify China in 221 BCE. His rule marked the foundation of imperial China, and he is famed for monumental projects like the initial construction of the Great Wall.
- **examples:**
  - 秦始皇统一六国(秦始皇統一六國)。
    - Qín Shǐhuáng tǒngyī liùguó.
    - Qin Shi Huang unified the Six States.
  - 秦始皇修建长城(秦始皇修建長城)，铸就了永恒的传说(鑄就了永恆的傳說)。
    - Qín Shǐhuáng xiūjiàn chángchéng, zhùjiù le yǒnghéng de chuánshuō.
    - Qin Shi Huang built the Great Wall, forging an everlasting legend.

    - "you're welcome" or "don't mention it"

Originally, the characters 客(客) (kè, "guest") and 气(氣) (qì, "manner") together suggest the idea of showing etiquette or hospitality as one would to a guest. By adding 不(不) (bù, "not"), it conveys the relaxed, friendly sense that there's no need for the person to feel like a guest engaging in formalities.

### 星期(星期) → 星(星) → 晶(晶)
- **definition:** twinkling stars
- **pinyin:** jīng
- **components:**
  - 日
    - rì
    - sun
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:**
    - 日(日) (rì, "sun") tripled to depict multiple suns or sparkles ->
    - brightness or sparkle
  - **interpretation:** The character 晶(jīng) represents brightness by repeating the character 日(日) (rì, "sun") three times, symbolizing multiple sources of light or sparkles. This construction effectively conveys the sense of brilliance or clarity associated with crystals and sparkling objects.
- **examples:**
  - 透明的水晶(透明的水晶)，闪耀着迷人的光芒(閃耀著迷人的光芒)。
    - Tòumíng de shuǐjīng, shǎnyào zhe mírén de guāngmáng.
    - The transparent crystal sparkles with enchanting light.
  - 湖面上映出倒影(湖面上映出倒影)，散发着晶的光彩(散發著晶的光彩)。
    - Húmiàn shàng yìngchū dàoyǐng, sànfā zhe jīng de guāngcǎi.
    - Reflections appear on the lake surface, emitting a sparkling brilliance.
  - 洁白的玉石中隐含着晶的韵味(潔白的玉石中隱含著晶的韻味)。
    - Jiébái de yùshí zhōng yǐnhán zhe jīng de yùnwèi.
    - The pure jade subtly reveals a sparkling charm.
### 星期(星期) → 星(星) → 晶(晶) → 日(日)
- **definition:** sun
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts the sun; a dot or line added in the center to distinguish from similar characters e.g. 囗
  - **interpretation:** As a pictogram, 日(rì, 'sun') directly represents the sun. In ancient times, the added dot helped visually differentiate it from other characters. This is analogous to the astronomical symbol ☉ and Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳, both depicting the sun.
- **examples:**
  - 晨曦来临时(晨曦來臨時)，日出东方(日出東方)。
    - Chénxī láilín shí, rìchū dōngfāng.
    - At the break of dawn, the sun rises in the east.
  - 温暖的日光洒满大地(溫暖的日光灑滿大地)。
    - Wēnnuǎn de rìguāng sǎ mǎn dàdì.
    - The warm sunlight spreads over the earth.
  - 中午时分(中午時分)，日高挂天(日高掛天)。
    - Zhōngwǔ shífēn, rì gāo guà tiān.
    - At noon, the sun hangs high in the sky.
### 星期(星期) → 星(星) → 生(生)
- **definition:** grow
- **pinyin:** shēng
- **components:**
  - 屮
    - chè
    - sprout
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:**
    - 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout") on top of a horizontal line ->
    - signifies a plant sprouting from the ground ->
    - symbolizes life
  - **interpretation:** The character 生(生) (shēng, "life") represents the concept of life force or vitality, symbolized by a sprout emerging from the earth, embodying growth and renewal.
- **examples:**
  - 生命是一场美丽的旅程(生命是一場美麗的旅程)。
    - Shēngmìng shì yī chǎng měilì de lǚchéng.
    - Life is a beautiful journey.
  - 他在战场上奋力生存(他在戰場上奮力生存)。
    - Tā zài zhànchǎng shàng fènlì shēngcún.
    - He fights to live on the battlefield.
  - 这家餐厅的生鱼片非常新鲜(這家餐廳的生魚片非常新鮮)。
    - Zhè jiā cāntīng de shēngyúpiàn fēicháng xīnxiān.
    - The raw fish slices at this restaurant are very fresh.
### 星期(星期) → 星(星) → 生(生) → 屮(屮)
- **definition:** sprout
- **pinyin:** chè
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a sprout emerging from the ground
  - **interpretation:** The character 屮(屮) (chè, 'sprout') visually represents a seedling or sprout with its two leaves emerging, making it an archetypal pictogram that captures the idea of new plant life springing forth.
### 星期(星期) → 期(期)
- **definition:** period; phase; time
- **pinyin:** qī
- **components:**
  - 其
    - qí
    - his
  - 月
    - yuè
    - moon
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 其(其) (qí, "his") + 月(月) (yuè, "moon") =
    - period of time marked by the moon ->
    - period; phase; time
  - **interpretation:** The character 期(期) combines the semantic 月(月) (yuè, "moon"), representing a natural cycle of time, with the phonetic 其(其) (qí, "his") to suggest temporal relationships or durations. This reflects the traditional role of the moon in marking time in historical Chinese calendars.
- **examples:**
  - 考试期将至(考試期將至)，考生们紧张准备(考生們緊張準備)。
    - Kǎoshì qī jiāng zhì, kǎoshēng men jǐnzhāng zhǔnbèi.
    - The exam period is approaching, and the candidates are preparing nervously.
  - 他度过了一个充满期待的艺术期(他度過了一個充滿期待的藝術期)。
    - Tā dùguò le yīgè chōngmǎn qīdài de yìshù qī.
    - He experienced an art phase full of anticipation.
  - 这个经济期虽然艰难(這個經濟期雖然艱難)，但蕴藏着无限可能(但蘊藏著無限可能)。
    - Zhège jīngjì qī suīrán jiānnán, dàn yùncáng zhe wúxiàn kěnéng.
    - Although this economic period is tough, it holds infinite possibilities.
### 星期(星期) → 期(期) → 其(其)
- **definition:** his
- **pinyin:** qí
- **components:**
  - 箕
    - jī
    - basket
  - 竹
    - zhú
    - bamboo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:**
    - 𠀠 (basket pictogram) ->
    - 丌 (stand) added under basket as phonetic and to enhance meaning ->
    - borrowed for pronoun 'his' ->
    - 箕(箕) (jī, 'basket') derived with additional 竹(竹) (zhú, 'bamboo')
  - **interpretation:** The character originally depicted a basket, symbolized by 𠀠, emphasizing its use. The addition of 丌 beneath the basket strengthened the meaning of a structural object or container, eventually leading to its phonetic borrowing to represent the pronoun 'his'. To reclaim the original meaning of a 'basket', 箕(箕) (jī, 'basket') was formed with an added bamboo radical.
- **examples:**
  - 将军因其英勇闻名(將軍因其英勇聞名)。
    - Jiāngjūn yīn qí yīngyǒng wénmíng。
    - The general is famous for his valor.
  - 同袍尊其忠诚(同袍尊其忠誠)，士卒佩服其英明(士卒佩服其英明)。
    - Tóngpáo zūn qí zhōngchéng, shìzú pèifú qí yīngmíng。
    - His comrades revere his loyalty, and the soldiers admire his wisdom.
### 星期(星期) → 期(期) → 其(其) → 箕(箕)
- **definition:** basket
- **pinyin:** jī
- **components:**
  - 竹
    - zhú
    - bamboo
  - 其
    - qí
    - his
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:**
    - 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo") + 其(其) (qí, "his") =
    - combines bamboo element with phonetic component 其 to convey 'basket' ->
    - specialization of 其
  - **interpretation:** The character 箕(箕) (jī, "basket") was created to specify the meaning of 'basket' by adding the bamboo radical 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo") to the character 其(其) (qí, "his"), which provides the phonetic cue. This reflects its use as a container often made from bamboo.
- **examples:**
  - 老农用箕收割稻谷(老農用箕收割稻穀)。
    - Lǎo nóng yòng jī shōugē dào gǔ。
    - The old farmer uses a basket to harvest rice.
  - 在村口(在村口)，小贩将粮食倒进箕中(小販將糧食倒進箕中)。
    - Zài cūnkǒu, xiǎofàn jiāng liángshí dào jìn jī zhōng。
    - At the village entrance, the vendor pours grain into the basket.
### 星期(星期) → 期(期) → 其(其) → 箕(箕) → 竹(竹)
- **definition:** bamboo
- **pinyin:** zhú
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts bamboo stalks with leaves
  - **interpretation:** The character 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo") visually represents two stalks of bamboo with leaves at the top, illustrating the appearance of bamboo plants traditionally found in nature.

### 星期(星期) → 期(期) → 月(月)
- **definition:** moon
- **pinyin:** yuè
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Depicts a crescent moon
  - **interpretation:** The character 月(yuè, "moon") is a pictographic representation of a crescent moon, straightforwardly capturing the curved shape often associated with the moon's appearance. Though interchangeable with 夕 (xī, "evening") in the past, it distinctly represents the moon in this usage.
- **examples:**
  - 夜空挂着明月(夜空掛著明月)。
    - Yè kōng guà zhe míng yuè.
    - The bright moon hangs in the night sky.
  - 人们赏月(人們賞月)，寄托相思(寄託相思)。
    - Rén men shǎng yuè, jì tuō xiāng sī.
    - People enjoy the moon, expressing their longing.

### diànhuà hàomǎ
---
- **definition:** telephone number
- **pinyin:** diànhuà hàomǎ
- **components:**
  - 电话(電話)
    - diànhuà
    - telephone; phone call
  - 号码(號碼)
    - hàomǎ
    - number; code
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:**
    - 電(電) (diàn, "electricity") + 話(話) (huà, "speech") forms 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone"), which refers to the device for transmitting spoken communication through electric signals. 號(號) (hào, "number") + 碼(碼) (mǎ, "code") combine as 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number"), meaning a numerical identifier. Together, 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone") + 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number") =
    - 'telephone number'.
  - **interpretation:** A 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone") is used for communication, and its 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number") is the unique sequence that identifies a particular phone line for dialing.
  - **simplification:** 電話號碼 is the same in simplified.
- **examples:**
  - 请给我你的电话号码(請給我你的電話號碼)。
    - Qǐng gěi wǒ nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ.
    - Please give me your telephone number.
  - 我忘记了电话号码(我忘記了電話號碼)，需要再确认(需要再確認)。
    - Wǒ wàngjìle diànhuà hàomǎ, xūyào zài quèrèn.
    - I forgot the telephone number, and I need to confirm it again.

- **pinyin:** yī
- **components:**
  - 匸
    - xì
    - that which hides; that which stores
